ARABIC: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَىْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: which left nothing it touched without turning it to dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Which turned everything it touched to ashes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: that left nothing that it came upon without reducing it to rubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which turned everything it approached into dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It left out nothing in its path, but which it split up into fragments.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It spared nothing that it reached, but blew it into broken spreads of rotten ruins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: It did not leave aught on which it blew, but it made it like ashes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that left nothing it came upon, but made it as stuff decayed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: It spared naught that it reached, but made it (all) as dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and it destroyed everything over which it passed and reduced it to dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: It left not aught whereon it came but it made it as matter decayed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It left nothing that it came upon without making it like decayed bones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It left nothing whatever that it came up against, but reduced it to ruin and rottenness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: It spared nothing that it reached, but blew it into broken spreads of rotten ruins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: that left nothing it came upon, except that it was ashes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It spared nothing it came upon, but rendered it like decayed ruins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:42] It did not leave anything, any soul or property, that it came upon without making it like decayed bones, like something that is withered and in scattered pieces.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (It spared naught) neither them nor their belongings (that it reached) that the wind reached to, (but made it (all) as dust.
